title: About me
description: As a developer and designer, I like creating unique and effective designs for businesses that help them stand out from the crowd. I have a strong interest in storytelling and the ability of websites to transform a boring idea into an exciting one. I'm interested in developing user-friendly interfaces that are straightforward and easy to use.
Sharing my knowledge and experience with others makes me very happy. I appreciate educating others about technology and how to apply it in website design.
Apart from my work activities, I have a significant interest in Afro and Latin dance. This creative activity keeps me stimulated and motivated, and it gives my job as a designer a new perspective.

items.title: 3rd place in the Scientific Research Session @The Bucharest University of Economic Studies
description: • Investigated and examined the issues that organizations encounter when utilizing numerous applications for various tasks such as HRIS, Ticketing, and Project Management.
• Provided a user-friendly solution by proposing an integrated platform to consolidate and simplify the use of various apps.
• Created a web application for the integrated platform.
• Created cross-browser and cross-platform solutions to ensure widespread accessibility and usability.

items.title: Enterprise Design Thinking Co-Creator @IBM
description: • Lead design thinking workshops and sessions, encouraging team members to think creatively and solve problems from a user-centric standpoint.
• Collaborate closely with stakeholders to discover business issues and opportunities, which are then translated into design thinking initiatives and projects.
• Work with cross-functional teams to collect insights, perform user research, and evaluate data to help inform the design process.
• Contribute to the creation of personas, journey maps, and other design thinking artifacts in order to obtain a better knowledge of the needs and pain points of users.

items.title: Computer Science Bachelor's Degree @The Bucharest University of Economic Studies
description: • Studied core computer science topics such as algorithms, data structures, computer architecture, programming languages, and operating systems;
• Gained knowledge and skills in programming languages such as Java, C++, Python, and SQL;
• Developed critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills through assignments, projects, and exams;
• Participated in team projects, working collaboratively with other students to design, develop, and test software applications;
• Completed coursework in topics such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, data mining, and web development;
• Attended various workshops and events organized by the university's computer science department to learn about the latest trends and technologies in the field.

items.title: Teacher module 1 @The Bucharest University of Economic Studies
description: • Completed training to become a certified teacher for students up to 11th grade (16-17 years old);
• Developed lesson plans and teaching materials for computer science topics such as programming basics, data structures, and algorithms;
• Delivered lectures and led discussions in the classroom, providing guidance and support to students as they learned;
• Evaluated student performance through assignments, projects, and exams, providing feedback and grades to help students improve their skills and knowledge.

items.title: Ux Engineer @Exe Software
description: • Design and build mobile-friendly web applications;
• Executing   all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering;
• Creating wireframes, mock-ups and design ideas;
• Collaborate with the content and development teams, from briefs to implementation;
• Work with HTML5, CSS3, SCSS, Visual Studio, Bootstrap, .NET, Adobe CC, JavaScript, React, Vue;
• Build innovative web designs and user interfaces;
• Develop cross-browser and cross-platform compatible solutions

items.title: Javascript Developer @Capgemini
description: • Define evolutive data models - creating the app's database
• Define business workflows - passing and transforming data between various stages of the business process
• Define validation and security access rules
• Map out the user journeys - building out the apps’s Web digital journey and its custom logic
• Insert and configure a variety of interface components, putting them together in HTML and styling them with CSS (Bootstrap)
• Integrate data automation processors (OCR, face recognition, video conferencing, digital signatures, etc.) for more complex steps in the user journeys
• Configure and interact with decision engines (scoring & personalization)
• Use JavaScript for advanced mathematical, logical and data manipulation tasks

items.title: Gannt diagram & Project Budgeting Training @SiSC
description: • Led a training session on time management best practices, including budgeting and scheduling
• Used real-world examples and case studies to illustrate key concepts
• Provided personalized feedback on participants' project plans

items.title: React Training @SiSC
description: • Presented advanced concepts in React JavaScript library
• Discussed the latest trends and techniques for building complex React applications
• Covered the basics of Redux and other state management libraries

items.title: UI/UX Training @SiSC
description: • Presented advanced concepts in user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) design
• Discussed the latest trends and techniques for creating engaging and effective UI/UX designs
• Provided insights into the latest tools and technologies for UI/UX design

items.title: Career Path Workshop @MLSA
description: • Presented the topic of career paths in the tech industry
• Discussed various options for career advancement and how to achieve them
• Provided insights into the latest trends and technologies in the industry

items.title: HTML Training @MLSA
description: • Presented the fundamentals of HTML
• Covered the basics of semantic markup and document structure
• Discussed the latest best practices for HTML development

items.title: SEO Training @MLSA
description: • Presented the fundamentals of Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
• Discussed the latest best practices and techniques for improving search engine rankings
• Provided insights into the latest trends in the industry and how to stay ahead of the competition

items.title: UI / UX Introduction Training @MLSA
description: • Presented the fundamentals of user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) design
• Covered the basics of wireframing and prototyping
• Discussed the latest best practices and techniques for creating effective UI/UX designs

items.title: React Refresher Training @SiSC
description: • Presented an overview of the React JavaScript library
• Discussed the latest best practices and techniques for React development
• Covered the basics of building reusable components and managing state in React applications

items.title: UI/UX + HTML/CSS Training @SiSC
description: • Presented the fundamentals of user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) design
• Covered the basics of HTML and CSS development
• Discussed the latest best practices and techniques for creating effective UI/UX designs

items.title: Frontend Developer @SiSC - Sindicatul Studenților din Cibernetică
description: • Creating and updating applications / sites of internal and external projects using HTML, CSS and JavaScript;
• Resolving bugs of internal and external applications / sites;
• Explaining the functionality and use of applications / sites for members of other departments;
• Adaptation on various frameworks, depending on the chosen project;
• Loading materials created on GitLab;
• Connecting the Front-end with the Back-end via APIs;

items.title: Solutions Architect @MLSA ASE
description: • Finding the best tech solution among all possible to solve the existing business problems.
• Describing the structure, characteristics, behavior, and other aspects of software to project stakeholders.
• Defining features, phases, and solution requirements.
• Providing specifications according to which the solution is defined, managed, and delivered.
• Focused mainly on web technologies.

items.title: Technology Member @Microsoft Learn Student Ambassadors Romania ASE
description: • Creating and updating internal and external applications and the site using both Front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Bootstrap) and Back-end technologies (Asp.net, .net, C#);
• Resolving the bugs of internal and external applications and the site;
• Explaining the functionality and use of applications / sites for members of other departments;
• Loading materials created on GitHub.

items.title: Project Manager Dare to Speak @SiSC
description: • Coordinates the activities within the project, directly supervising the association's teams.
• Makes proposals to improve the work style in order to maximize the efficiency of achieving the proposed objectives.
• Evaluates the impact of the project and communicates it to the management, financiers and project partners.
• Monitors in time the progress achieved towards the proposed objectives and writes reports every 2 weeks to the executive office, the management office and the department leaders.

items.title: Computer Science Teacher @Dalia's Book
description: • Introducing elementary school students to algorithms through education.
• Developing and evaluating a curriculum that aligns with students' learning progression.
• Evaluates the impact of the project and communicates it to the management, financiers and project partners.
• Evaluating and assisting students with their project presentations through testing.
